questions.question: Please blow .................................... these balloons and hang them around the room.
questions.description: To blow up balloons is to fill them with air.

questions.question: Can you turn ................................. the volume a bit?
questions.description: To turn up the volume is to raise the volume.

questions.question: Tomorrow I am going to blow ................................. 39 candles on my birthday cake.
questions.description: To blow out candles is to extinguish them.

questions.question: We pulled .............................. a surprise party for the newly married couple.
questions.description: To pull off something is to succeed in doing something difficult.

questions.question: They were all dressed ................................... for the party.
questions.description: To dress up is to wear better/fancier clothes than you usually wear.

questions.question: I enjoy hanging ................................. with my friends at my house.
questions.description: To hang out with your friends is to spend time relaxing.

questions.question: When will you come to pick me ...............................?
I am eating ................................... a lot these days.
questions.description: To eat out is to eat in a restaurant.

questions.question: I invited her to tea but she turned ………………………….. my offer.
questions.description: To turn down an offer is to reject it.

questions.question: I am going to keep asking her …………………….. until she says ‘Yes’.
questions.description: To ask someone out is to invite them to come with you to a place.

questions.question: Cheer ……………………… You will win next time.
questions.description: This is an expression used to encourage someone to have a more positive attitude.

questions.question: The children cracked ………………………… as soon as the clown arrived on the scene.
questions.description: To crack up is to burst out laughing.
